thread.title: Obama wins 17th House Dem vote for trade
thread.title_full: Obama wins 17th House Dem vote for trade

author: iswanson@thehill.com (Vicki Needham)
title: Obama wins 17th House Dem vote for trade
text:
Obama wins 17th House Dem vote for trade By Vicki Needham - 06/05/15 11:54 AM EDT 
Rep. Derek Kilmer (Wash.), whose state is one of the nation’s largest exporters, will back trade promotion authority (TPA), an aide told The Hill. 
Kilmer would be the 17th House Democrat to back TPA or fast-track authority for President Obama, according to The Hill’s Whip List . ADVERTISEMENT The House could vote as early as next week on fast-track. Obama is aggressively lobbying Democrats, while House GOP leaders are trying to win over their members.
Labor unions and other liberal groups oppose fast-track, which would ensure an up-or-down vote on the Trans-Pacific Partnership trade deal by preventing lawmakers from amending it. The TPP is being negotiated by the U.S. with 11 other nations. 
Obama could need as many as two dozen House Democrats to back him in order to win the vote. 
Obama told Rep. Jim Himes earlier this week that he had 20 Democratic votes, according to Himes. The Connecticut Democrat came out in favor of fast-track on Thursday, and Obama won another key Democratic vote in Rep. Don Beyer (Va.). 
Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi (D-Calif.) is not whipping the vote for Obama, and on Thursday said it was Speaker John Boehner’s (R-Ohio) responsibility to win votes for the measure. She guessed there were no more than 18 Democratic votes for fast-track. 
Rep. Paul Ryan (R-Wis.), chairman of the Ways and Means Committee, acknowledged this week that his side doesn’t have the votes yet. But he also said he was more confident than before that he would get the votes to pass. 
Republicans hold 245 seats in the lower chamber and they need 218 to pass the trade legislation. Tags: Past: 1 day Republicans wield power of the...
